CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1946, pg. 17 reads: "The World Celebrates - The bright costumes of polish and Italian peasants, the breaking of a colorful Mexican pinata (animal figure), stuffed with candies and nuts, Greek dances, a magician's show, American folk and square dances will be on the program at the All-Nations Holiday party tonight (Thursday) at Addison Hall, Addison Terrace. Members of the program committee of the celebration, sponsored by Soho Community House, are attired in the Italian and Polish costumes in which they will greet guests.  They are, left to right: Mrs. Marjorie Putnam, Mrs. Clara Brown, Mrs. Lillian Landy and Mrs. Helen Watson. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Marjorie Putnam, Clara Brown, Lillian Landy, and Helen Watson, wearing Polish and Italian ethnic clothing, posed on top of table in Addison Hall for All-Nations Holiday party
